citations.narrative:
On April 25, 2024, a 4-year-old male lemur escaped from his primary enclosure and was never recovered. According to
the facility representative, the lemur was observed inside the enclosure the previous evening and they do not know how
the primate escaped. Primary enclosures that do not securely contain the animal can lead to animal escapes, injuries, or
death.
The facility must ensure that primary enclosures for nonhuman primates are designed and constructed so that they are
structurally sound for the species of nonhuman primates housed in them. They must contain the nonhuman primates
securely and prevent accidental opening of the enclosure, including opening by the animal. Correct from this date forward
of May 9,2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.80(a)(2)(iii)  Critical
   
Primary enclosures. 
On April 25, 2024, a 4-year-old male lemur escaped from his primary enclosure and was never recovered. According to 
the facility representative, the lemur was observed inside the enclosure the previous evening and they do not know how 
the primate escaped. Primary enclosures that do not securely contain the animal can lead to animal escapes, injuries, or 
death. 
 
The facility must ensure that primary enclosures for nonhuman primates are designed and constructed so that they are 
structurally sound for the species of nonhuman primates housed in them. They must contain the nonhuman primates 
securely and prevent accidental opening of the enclosure, including opening by the animal. Correct from this date forward 
of May 9,2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n

species.common: RED FOX (INCLUDES SILVER FOX & CROSS FOX)
